FuncDef:
The nat alarm user-table threshold command sets the alarm threshold for the total number of user tables.
The undo nat alarm user-table threshold command restores the default alarm threshold for the total number of user tables.
The default alarm threshold of user tables is 80%.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the alarm threshold of user tables.
The value is an integer ranging from 60 to 90, in percentage. The default value is 80.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] undo nat alarm user-table log disable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the alarm threshold of the total number of user tables, run the nat alarm user-table threshold command. If user table usage reaches the alarm threshold, a service board sends an alarm to the NMS.
Prerequisites
The trap or log function has been enabled for user tables using the nat alarm user-table command.
Configuration Impact
If user table usage reaches the specified alarm threshold, the service board sends an alarm to the NMS. If user table usage exceeds the alarm threshold, the service board does not repeatedly send an alarm. After user table usage falls to 87.5%, the service board sends a clear alarm to the NMS.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
